title: 6 Enchanting Castle Hotels in Germany
text:
The Best Castle Hotels in Germany Your Hotel is Your Castle - Royal Accommodation in Germany By Birge Amondson Updated June 10, 2016 . 
The landscape of Germany is graced by more than 20,000 castles and palaces . Some are in ruins, but many castles are picture perfect and home to interesting museums and restaurants. Even better? You can live your own fairy tale by spending the night in a medieval German castle. 
Many German castles have been turned into castle hotels, offering a unique experience for couples and families alike. And the best: It doesn't cost a king's ransom to stay at one of Germany's castle hotels. 
Travel back in time with my top-picks of the best castle hotels in Germany. Stiller Beobachter/CC/Flickr 1. Castle Hotel Colmberg 
Set in Bavaria, the 3,000-year-old Castle Colmberg is a destination on both the Romantic Road and the Castle Road . This hotel has it all: ancient stone towers, fortified walls, overgrown royal stables, and a deer reserve. Ask for one of the historic rooms that have four-poster beds, centuries-old paintings, antique furniture, and wooden ceilings. 
continue reading below our video America's Best Foodie Cities 2. Castle Hotel Auf Schönburg 
Perched on a hill, the impressive Castle Auf Schönburg is located in the picturesque landscape of the Middle Rhine Valley, a UNESCO World Heritage site. 
Castle Auf Schönburg has a library, a romantic restaurant by candle light , and two terraces looking out onto vineyard-covered hills. One of the best hotel rooms is the tower room; its wooden balcony sits high up above the Rhine, like a bird’s nest on the castle’s stone tower.
